TEXT: CARDINAL . At the time of the events , the applicant , a journalist , was the regional correspondent for ORG for the national newspapers “ NORP ” and “ ORG ” .

CARDINAL . A newspaper article , contributed by the applicant , was published in “ ORG ” in its issue no . CARDINAL of DATE under the title “ Defendants [ charged with ] kidnapping call for [ criminal proceedings against ] the police officers who arrested them ” ( “ GPE за отвличане поискаха съд за полицаите , прибрали ги в ареста ” ) .
The text of the article read as follows :

“ The lawyers of the CARDINAL defendants in the case regarding the kidnapping of nurse PERSON petitioned ORG to open a preliminary investigation against CARDINAL [ policemen ] from FAC . The [ defendants ' ] case is [ currently ] being heard by ORG .

Police officer ORG and policemen T. and B. participated in the arrest of the abductors on DATE ] , but disguised as drivers of the luxury cars of the local businessman PERSON The owner of a chain of establishments ... had gone to the police , had claimed that he had been kidnapped and had named his abductors .

[ Later ] that night his men [ wearing ] bullet proof jackets with police insignia and carrying machine guns raided the residence of the alleged abductors . With the consent of the CARDINAL policemen they took the arrestees to the mountain range near ORG . [ There they held them for ] DATE and beat them with metal rods after which they took them to the police station . The relatives of the injured and the [ abductors ' ] medical certificates provide evidence as to the rage of their attackers . Charges were brought against the CARDINAL abductors , among who is PERSON ... who was recently sentenced to DATE imprisonment in [ a related case ] . He had been charged with organising the abduction of the nurse and the businessman . His case had been separated from those of the other [ accused ] . ORG ruled that ORG has DATE to decide whether there is enough evidence [ to justify ] the opening of a preliminary investigation against the [ CARDINAL policemen ] . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE policeman PERSON filed a complaint against the applicant and petitioned ORG to open criminal proceedings against him for libel of an official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions .

CARDINAL . The applicant was summoned by ORG Office on DATE and gave a written statement . He stated that he had simply reported on a request made by the lawyer of the alleged abductors during a hearing in the criminal proceedings before the ORG whereby he had demanded that the criminal proceedings be initiated against the police officers . The applicant also stated that CARDINAL of the witnesses in the proceedings before ORG had made a similar request to ORG .

CARDINAL . Subsequently , ORG obtained a copy of the court transcript which showed that CARDINAL of the witnesses , the father of CARDINAL of the accused , had given testimony implicating certain policemen in the beating of their son , but had not named policeman PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE the case file was reassigned to ORG .

CARDINAL . The Sofia District Prosecutor 's Office issued instructions to the police on CARDINAL DATE to interview the applicant in order to identify the source of his information and the basis for his claims that policeman PERSON had participated in the arrest of the alleged abductors .

CARDINAL . The applicant was questioned once more on CARDINAL DATE . He confirmed that his article was based on statements made by the lawyer of the alleged abductors and on a petition filed on CARDINAL DATE by CARDINAL of his clients , PERSON , requesting that proceedings be initiated against the arresting officers . He claimed that in the said petition , a copy of which had been shown to the applicant , it had been stated that policeman PERSON had been CARDINAL of the CARDINAL policemen who had been present and had not intervened when the men of the local businessman had beaten them up .

CARDINAL . The police prepared a report on CARDINAL DATE in which they detailed their additional findings . It noted that they had obtained a copy of the petition filed on CARDINAL DATE by PERSON PERSON and that therein it had only been claimed that policeman PERSON was CARDINAL of several policemen present when Mr PERSON had been brought to the police station for questioning , had threatened him verbally and had made him sign several blank statement sheets . The report also claimed that after having shared their additional findings with the applicant the latter had realised his mistake and had expressed a readiness to apologise to policeman PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE the case file was transferred back to GPE Prosecutor 's Office .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date in DATE ORG refused to open a preliminary investigation against the applicant as it found that there was insufficient evidence of a criminal offence . Policeman B. appealed against the decision on DATE .

CARDINAL . By decision of DATE ORG quashed the decision of the lower - standing ORG as it found that the evidence against the applicant was sufficient to warrant the opening of a preliminary investigation against him and remitted the case with instructions that such proceedings be initiated .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG opened a preliminary investigation against the applicant for libel of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions committed in print [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) and LAW ( ORG ) ] . A restriction was also placed on the applicant not to leave his place of residence without the consent of ORG , which was not lifted until the end of the criminal proceedings against him . The case file was then transferred for further investigation by ORG with the following instruction : “ The investigation must perform the following : Procedurally document the offence . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE policeman PERSON and an acquaintance of his were questioned .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was charged with libel through falsely incriminating a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions committed in print by another public official [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and ( CARDINAL ) and LAW ] . He was questioned on DATE and then again on DATE . On both occasions he reiterated his previously given statements in that he had relied on statements and information received from third persons and expressed a readiness to apologise to policeman PERSON if he had in fact been misled .
CARDINAL . NORP The results of the preliminary investigation were presented to the applicant and policeman PERSON on DATE . The case file was then transferred to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG remitted the case to the investigation stage because it found serious deficiencies in the investigation . In particular , that there was no information regarding the status of policeman PERSON as a public official and regarding the nature of the offence which the applicant had allegedly claimed to have been committed by the policeman .
CARDINAL . Subsequently , on an unspecified date , the investigation obtained a copy of the employment contract of policeman B.

CARDINAL . On DATE the charges against the applicant were amended to libel of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions through dissemination of disreputable facts in print by another public official [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and LAW ] . On DATE he was also questioned and the preliminary investigation was presented to him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the preliminary investigation was presented to policeman PERSON and on DATE , the CARDINALth , the case file was transferred to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed an indictment with GPE against the applicant for libel of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions through dissemination of disreputable facts in print by another public official [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and LAW of the ORG ] .

CARDINAL . On DATE a judge - rapporteur of ORG remitted the case back to ORG for correction of serious procedural deficiencies such as to indicate the offence with which the applicant was being charged in reference to the facts of the case and what his intent had been .

CARDINAL . NORP The charges against the applicant were slightly amended on DATE but remained libel of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions through dissemination of disreputable facts in print by another public official [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and LAW ] . He was also questioned on DATE .
CARDINAL . The preliminary investigation was presented to policeman PERSON on DATE and to the applicant on DATE . The case file was transferred to GPE Prosecutor 's Office on DATE , DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG filed a new indictment with ORG against the applicant for libel of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions through dissemination of disreputable facts in print by another public official [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and LAW of the ORG ] .

CARDINAL . On DATE a judge - rapporteur of the Sofia ORG remitted the case back to ORG for correction of a serious procedural deficiency . Namely , she found that it was still not clear for what offence the applicant was being tried because the charge brought against him on DATE for libel through falsely incriminating a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions committed in print by another public official was still standing .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Sofia ORG dropped the charge of libel through falsely incriminating a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions committed in print by another public official .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the Sofia District Prosecutor 's Office filed a new indictment with the Sofia ORG against the applicant for libel of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions through dissemination of disreputable facts in print by another public official [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) and LAW of the ORG ] .
CARDINAL . On DATE a judge - rapporteur of the ORG set a date for the first court hearing for DATE .

CARDINAL . The hearings of DATE , DATE and DATE were adjourned due to non - attendance of various parties . The applicant was ill for the first hearing , his lawyer could not attend the second and for the third hearing both the applicant and policeman PERSON could not reach PERSON due to heavy snowfall .

CARDINAL . At the court hearing on DATE ORG petitioned GPE to remit the case for correction of a serious procedural deficiency as it claimed that there was still a lack of clarity as to what the applicant was being charged with . The court refused and proceeded to hear the case . It also recognised policeman B. as a civil claimant . The hearing was adjourned so as to allow the parties to collect and present additional documents and evidence .
CARDINAL . On DATE an amendment to the ORG entered into force ( see below , Relevant domestic law ) , which had the effect of reducing the statute of limitations for libel to DATE .

CARDINAL . At the next hearing on DATE the representative of ORG petitioned the court to discontinue the proceedings due to the expiration of the statute of limitations . GPE granted the request and discontinued the criminal proceedings against the applicant .

CARDINAL . DATE Article CARDINAL of the ORG envisaged a punishment of DATE imprisonment and a public reprimand for the offence of libel disseminated in print of a public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions by another public official during or in connection with the exercise of his duties or functions [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ] . The statute of limitations was DATE [ LAW ( CARDINAL ) ] and it was a publicly prosecuted offence ( LAW ) .

CARDINAL . Following the amendments of DATE the punishment for the above stated offence was changed to a fine of QUANTITY CARDINAL and CARDINAL euros ( ORG ) ] and a public reprimand [ Article CARDINAL § CARDINAL in connection with § CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ] . As a result , the statute of limitations fell to DATE [ LAW ( CARDINAL ) ] . It also became a privately prosecuted offence ( LAW § CARDINAL ) .

CARDINAL . The relevant part of ORG of DATE ( the “ ORG ” ) provides that the ORG is liable for damage caused by the organs of the investigation , the prosecution and the courts for having unlawfully charged a private person with an offence if ( CARDINAL ) he / she is declared innocent or ( CARDINAL ) the initiated criminal proceedings are terminated because ( a ) the deed was not perpetrated by the said person or ( b ) the perpetrated deed is not an offence or because ( CARDINAL ) the criminal proceedings were initiated after the expiration of the statute of limitations for the offence or after the deed had been amnestied [ section CARDINAL ( CARDINAL ) ] .
